title: 107_s1058
content: The Act may be cited as the "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" and includes an amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding a credit for biodiesel used as fuel. The "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a biodiesel fuels credit based on the biodiesel mixture rate for qualified blends used by taxpayers in a taxable year. The "Biodiesel Renewable Fuels Act" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a biodiesel fuels credit based on the biodiesel mixture rate for qualified blends used by taxpayers in a taxable year. The biodiesel mixture rate varies depending on the blend, with rates of 3.0 cents for a B-2 blend and 20.0 cents for a B-20 blend. The terms 'B-1 blend', 'B-2 blend', and 'B-20 blend' refer to qualified biodiesel mixtures with varying biodiesel content percentages. B-1 blend contains 0.5% to less than 2.0% biodiesel, B-2 blend contains 2.0% to less than 20% biodiesel, and B-20 blend contains at least 20% biodiesel. A qualified biodiesel mixture contains at least 20 percent biodiesel. The applicable amount is calculated based on the percentage of biodiesel in the blend. A qualified biodiesel mixture contains at least 20 percent biodiesel and is sold or used by the taxpayer producing it for fuel purposes in their trade or business. The biodiesel mixture must be sold or used in the taxpayer's trade or business for the credit to apply, and casual off-farm production is not eligible. Coordination with the exemption from excise tax is also considered. The biodiesel mixture must be used in the taxpayer's trade or business for the credit to apply. The credit amount may be reduced to account for benefits from other tax exemptions. "Biodiesel is defined as monoalkyl esters of long chain fatty acids from vegetable oils for use in diesel engines. It includes esters from various vegetable oils like corn, soybeans, and sunflower seeds." The biodiesel must meet EPA registration requirements for fuels and fuel additives under the Clean Air Act. If biodiesel is used in the production of a qualified biodiesel mixture and then separated, a tax may be imposed. A tax is imposed on any person who separates biodiesel from a mixture or uses the mixture other than as a fuel, based on the biodiesel mixture rate and the number of gallons. Applicable laws must be followed. A tax is imposed on biodiesel separation or use from a mixture, based on the biodiesel mixture rate and gallons. Applicable laws apply, and regulations for estates and trusts are similar to section 52 rules. An election can be made to exclude the biodiesel fuels credit. The Secretary's regulations apply, with rules similar to section 52. Taxpayers can elect to exclude the biodiesel fuels credit for any taxable year within a 3-year period before the return filing deadline. The biodiesel fuels credit can be excluded by taxpayers for any taxable year within a 3-year period before the return filing deadline. The election or revocation of the credit must be made as prescribed by the Secretary's regulations. Additionally, the biodiesel fuels credit is now treated as part of the general business credit under Section 38(b). The biodiesel fuels credit cannot be carried back before January 1, 2003, as per the recent amendments to Section 39(d) and Section 196(c). Additionally, a new item is added to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1, relating to the biodiesel fuels credit under section 40A. The amendments made by Section 40A apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001. The reduction of motor fuel excise taxes on biodiesel mixtures is addressed in Section 3. The amendment to Section 4081 introduces a new subsection (f) regarding the tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures. The rate of tax for these mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate. The tax rate for qualified biodiesel mixtures is reduced by the biodiesel mixture rate when diesel fuel is used to produce such mixtures. The Secretary will pay an amount equal to the per gallon cost for producing a qualified biodiesel mixture sold or used in a person's trade or business. HIGHWAY TRUST FUND HELD HARMLESS. Transfers will be made from the Commodity Credit Corporation to the Highway Trust Fund to offset reductions in receipts due to amendments made by this Act, based on estimates by the Secretary of the Treasury. Adjustments will be made for any errors in the estimates.
